page.description: The Code Library is a dockable toolbar that stores and organizes an unlimited number of Xbasic and Xdialog code snippets, retrieving and inserting them into your project with just a couple of keystrokes. To display the Code Library :

case.description: in the Interactive Window click the following.
select "Code Library" from the drop down menu of the floating window
in the Code Editor you may also select Code > Code Library

section.title: Managing Libraries
section.description: The Code Library allows you to create multiple named libraries, each of which may contain a large number of code snippets.

You can create new libraries, delete existing libraries, and import your Alpha Anywhere code library by right clicking on the Code Library window. The following image shows the Select Library to Delete dialog box. Code libraries are saved with a *.clip_lib extension in the code_libraries folder under your Alpha Anywhere program folder.

section.title: Using Libraries
section.description: After opening the Code Editor, either click Code > Code Library... or right click on the window and select Code Library.
The resulting Code Library menu has three sections. The top section contains commands. These three commands will:

case.description: Add selected text to the Code Library,
allow you to select the active library, and
hide or display the Code Library window.

section.title: Inserting a Favorite Code Clip
section.description: The next section of the Code Library menu is a list of favorites from any code library. Clicking one of these entries inserts the code snippet into the Code Editor at the cursor location. The largest section at the bottom contains up to 20 of the entries from the selected code library. Clicking one of these entries inserts the code snippet into the Code Editor at the cursor location. Clicking the entry displays the Select Code to Insert dialog box. This dialog box gives you the ability to inspect the contents of the code snippet you want to use.

section.title: Inserting Code from a Library
section.description: The user can add, delete, edit, view, insert, and execute entries in a selected library. Clicking on a library entry can result in three scenarios.

section.title: Running Xbasic Code
section.description: You can create "genies" that are invoked by inserting an entry on the Code Library. i.e. the Code Library can contain Xbasic code that is executed when you double click an entry. For example, assume you created an entry in the Code Library that looked like this:
section.example: '@script: dim name as C = "Ed" dim city as C = "Chester" dim company as C = "Alpha Software" code_to_insert = "Hello " + name + " from " + city + " who works at: " + company

section.description: Note that the code snippet must start with '@script: . The code can do anything you want, and when it completes executing the result of the string "code_to_insert" is inserted into the Code Editor at the current insertion point. The above example is obviously very simplistic because it does not have any user interface. Here is a more practical example:

section.title: Using the Scrapbook
section.description: The Scrapbook is a code library in Alpha Anywhere that acts like the Windows Clipboard. When you paste from the Scrapbook, you always paste the top entry in the Scrapbook. Unlike the Windows Clipboard, you can add many entries to the Scrapbook, and you can open it up to paste older entries. To paste from the Scrapbook, right click and select Paste from Scrapbook. Alternatively, open the Code Library by clicking the 'book' icon, selecting Scrapbook, and clicking the selected entry.

section.title: Using the Code Library
section.description: Method One:

step.description: Open the Code Editor.
Position your cursor in the Code Editor where you want to insert code.
Select Code > Code Library... or click the 'book' icon to display the Code Library.
Select a library from the drop-down list box at top.
Double-click on any entry. One of the following actions will occur, depending on how you defined this entry.
The code will be inserted at the cursor location in the Code Editor.
The code will display one or more dialog boxes to gather variable values and then insert the code.
The code will be executed.

section.description: Method Two: The right-click Code Library menu contains a list of favorites and a list of up to 20 of the entries from the current code library.

step.description: Open the Code Editor.

Right click on the code window.
Select Code > Library and select the name of the library entry.

section.title: Adding a New Library Entry
section.description: To add a new entry to the Code Library. Method One:

step.description: While viewing the Code Editor, click the 'book' icon to display the Code Library.
Select the library that will receive the new entry.
Select the code segment you wish to save.
Click the green '+' icon to display the Enter Description dialog box.
Optionally, check Put on Right click menu favorites? .
Enter a description of the new entry and click OK.

section.description: Method Two

step.description: Open the Code Editor.
Select the code to be added.
Click Code > Code Library... or click the 'book' icon.
Select the library of interest from the drop-down list at top.
Right click on the Code Library window and select Add Selected Text to Code Library.
Enter a description for the new entry.
Optionally, check Put on Right-Click menu favorites.
Click OK.

section.description: Method Three:

step.description: Open the Code Editor.
Select the code to be added.
Click Code > Code Library... or click the 'book' icon.
Select the code segment.
Click the '+' icon.
Open the Code Editor.
Click Code > Code Library... or click the 'book' icon.
Select the library of interest from the drop-down list at top.
Select the code clip of interest from the list box and click the following.
Optionally, change the Description of the code clip.
Edit the code as desired.
Optionally, check Add to favorites.
Click OK to save your changes or Cancel to discard them.
Open the Code Editor.
Click Code > Code Library... or click the 'book' icon.
Select the library of interest from the drop-down list at top.
Select the code clip of interest from the list box.
Click the 'X'.
Confirm your action by clicking Yes.
Open the Code Editor.
Click Code > Code Library... or click the 'book' icon.
Select the library of interest from the drop-down list at top.
Right click on the Code Library window and select Sort > Ascending or Sort > Descending.
